class Node

Detailed Description

This class is the class used for dynamic lighting within the scene.

Dynamic lights come in 3 flavors:
Directional - Used to simulate light from a very distant source. Doesn't need a location, only a direction. Light will hit all objects accordingly from that direction.
Point - Used to simulate local light sources that emit light in all directions. Doesn't need a direction, just a position.
Spotlight - Used to simulate local light sources that emit light in one direction, such as a flashlight. Needs both a position and direction. In addition needs values for falloff.
Note: If attaching a light to a node, all transform information(position and orientation) becomes relative to the nodes transform.

Definition at line 153 of file light.cpp.

void phys::Light::SetAttenuation ( Real  Range,
Real  Constant,
Real  Linear,
Real  Quadratic 
)

Sets the factors for the attenuation formula applied to this light.

This function is only necessary when using a spotlight or point type of light.

Parameters:
Range The absolute range of the light in world units. Objects beyond this range will not be influenced by this light.
Constant The constant of the attenuation, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. 1.0 means never attenuate, 0.0 is complete attenuation.
Linear The linear factor of the attentuation, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. 1.0 means attenuate evenly over the distance.
Quadratic The Quadratic factor of the attenuation. This value adds curvature to the attenuation.

Definition at line 119 of file light.cpp.

void phys::Light::SetDiffuseColour ( Real  Red,
Real  Green,
Real  Blue 
)

Sets the colour for the Diffuse light from this source.

When rendering the final color of an object values of the colours of 3 types of lights are taken into account. The 3 types are: Diffuse, Specular, and Ambient.

Parameters:
Red Real in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of red in the colour.
Red green in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of green in the colour.
Red blue in the range of 0.0 to 1.0 determining the amount of blue in the colour.

void phys::Light::SetSpotlightFalloff ( Real  Falloff  ) 

Sets the rate of falloff of the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.

Parameters:
Falloff The rate of falloff between the inner and outer cones. 1.0 means linear falloff. Less means slower falloff and higher means faster falloff.

Definition at line 137 of file light.cpp.

void phys::Light::SetSpotlightRange ( Real  InnerAngle,
Real  OuterAngle,
Real  Falloff = 1.0 
)

Defines the cone of light emitted by a spotlight.

InnerAngle and OuterAngle should be input as Radians.

Parameters:
InnerAngle Angle of the inner cone.
OuterAngle Angle of the outer cone.
Falloff The rate of falloff between the inner and outer cones. 1.0 means linear falloff. Less means slower falloff and higher means faster falloff.

The light types are listed with the class info. Types are Directional, Point, and Spotlight.
